A town formerly called Clark, in Texas, (with 55 homes) has just agreed to change its name to DISH in exchange for a decade of free satellite TV from the DISH network.
 
 I believe there's a town in Oklahoma called Gene Autry. There are probably other places that have adopted a "celebrity" identity for all I know. 
 
 But doesn't the idea of sponsored towns and cities open up a whole new scheme for keeping taxes down and adding to the fun of America ?
